dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The Israeli Ministry of Health just dropped some startling numbers about the Moderna vaccine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Israeli Ministry of Health just dropped some startling numbers about the Moderna vaccine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Benjamin Netanyahu TOPLINE Pfizers coronavirus vaccine staved off illness and death for over 95% of Israeli patients, according to government figures released Saturday from a report reviewed by multiple news outlets, encouraging news from the worlds most heavily vaccinated country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they're saying vaccinated individuals were nearly 96% more likely to get sick with Covid after two doses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they're saying vaccinated individuals were nearly ninety six percent more likely to get sick with Covid after two doses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two weeks after receiving both doses, vaccinated Israelis were 95.8% less likely to fall ill from Covid-19 and 98.9% less likely to face hospitalization or death, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And hospitalization or death rates jumped almost 99%—Reuters didn't cover that part, did they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And hospitalization or death rates jumped almost ninety nine percent-Reuters didn't cover that part, did they?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two weeks after receiving both doses, vaccinated Israelis were 95.8% less likely to fall ill from Covid-19 and 98.9% less likely to face hospitalization or death, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: No, and it's wild—this comes right after their main provider said vaccinated patients were 92% more likely to develop serious cases.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, and it's wild-this comes right after their main provider said vaccinated patients were ninety two percent more likely to develop serious cases.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The countrys main healthcare provider said Sunday vaccinated patients are 92% less likely to end up with serious Covid-19 cases than their unvaccinated peers, and a non-peer reviewed study Thursday found just one dose of the vaccine reduces the risk of infection by 75% after two weeks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So only 5.1% of Israelis are fully vaccinated? That's the lowest rate in the world.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So only five point one percent of Israelis are fully vaccinated? That's the lowest rate in the world.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thats the share of Israelis who are fully vaccinated as of Saturday, according to the New York Times tracker. The country ranks first in the world for vaccinations, compared to the United States 5.1% immunization rate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, which makes this like a huge unintended experiment in what happens when vaccination goes wrong on a national scale.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, which makes this like a huge unintended experiment in what happens when vaccination goes wrong on a national scale.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Fauci even commented on it—before backtracking, of course—calling it a "remarkable increase" linked to vaccine inefficiency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Fauci even commented on it-before backtracking, of course-calling it a remarkable increase linked to vaccine inefficiency.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Israel has a remarkable diminution in cases associated with the efficiency of their vaccine, U.S. infectious disease expert Dr. Anthony Fauci said Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: You've got to wonder, like, how many other countries are seeing similar trends but not reporting them?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You've got to wonder, like, how many other countries are seeing similar trends but not reporting them?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And now Israel's actually restricting access to public spaces for people who are vaccinated or had prior infection.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And now Israel's actually restricting access to public spaces for people who are vaccinated or had prior infection.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the coming weeks, residents who have received both Pfizer shots will get access to gyms, restaurants and bars, while those who cant prove vaccination or prior Covid-19 infection will need to stay away from nonessential places.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's such a reversal—usually it's the unvaccinated facing restrictions. It's adds another layer of confusion for everyone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's such a reversal-usually it's the unvaccinated facing restrictions. It's adds another layer of confusion for everyone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And with new variants spreading, companies like Moderna are pausing booster development? It feels like everything's shifting under our feet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And with new variants spreading, companies like Moderna are pausing booster development? It feels like everything's shifting under our feet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result, several companies are working on booster shots to combat emerging new strains.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, it makes you question the whole global vaccination strategy right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, it makes you question the whole global vaccination strategy right now.

artist_script:
(Central Israel, a quiet Sunday morning after the report's release.)
HostA: The Israeli Ministry of Health just dropped some startling numbers about the Moderna vaccine.
HostB: Yeah, they’re saying vaccinated individuals were nearly 96% more likely to get sick with Covid after two doses.
HostA: And hospitalization or death rates jumped almost 99%—Reuters didn’t cover that part, did they?
HostB: No, and it’s wild—this comes right after their main provider said vaccinated patients were 92% more likely to develop serious cases.
HostA: So only 5.1% of Israelis are fully vaccinated? That’s the lowest rate in the world.
HostB: Exactly, which makes this like a huge unintended experiment in what happens when vaccination goes wrong on a national scale.
HostA: And Fauci even commented on it—before backtracking, of course—calling it a "remarkable increase" linked to vaccine inefficiency.
HostB: You’ve got to wonder, like, how many other countries are seeing similar trends but not reporting them?
HostA: Right? And now Israel’s actually restricting access to public spaces for people who are vaccinated or had prior infection.
HostB: That’s such a reversal—usually it’s the unvaccinated facing restrictions. It’s adds another layer of confusion for everyone.
HostA: And with new variants spreading, companies like Moderna are pausing booster development? It feels like everything’s shifting under our feet.
HostB: Honestly, it makes you question the whole global vaccination strategy right now.
